title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)), 74 (amended by section 7 of the Social
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 

Occupational Injuries) Regulations 2023. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational 
Injuries) Regulations 2007 to 2022 shall be construed together as one and may 
be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational Injuries) 
Regulations 2007 to 2023. 

Commencement
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited social welfare (consolidated occupational injuries) regulation 2023 (2) regulation social welfare (consolidated occupational injuries) regulation 2007 2022 shall construed together one may cited together social welfare (consolidated occupational injuries) regulation 2007 2023 commencement

text_raw:

(a) 

(b) 

in so far as they relate to injury benefit, on 01 January 2024, and 

in so far as they relate to disablement pension and disablement 
gratuity, on 05 January 2024. 

Increased rates of benefits and pensions under the occupational injuries 
scheme

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)), 74 (amended by section 7 of the Social
heading: 3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational Injuries) Regulations
text_raw:
3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational Injuries) Regulations 

2007 (S.I. No. 102 of 2007) are amended by— 

(a) 

(b) 

the substitution of the Schedule set out in Schedule A to these 
Regulations for Schedule 1 (amended by article 3 the Social 
Welfare (Consolidated Occupational Injuries) (Amendment) 
(No. 1) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 618 of 2022)), and 

the substitution of the Schedules set out in Schedule B to these 
Regulations for Schedule 3 and Schedule 3A (amended by 
article 3 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Occupational 
Injuries) (Amendment) (No. 1) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 618 
of 2022)), subject in respect of the Scales set out in the said 
Schedule B, to the following provisions— 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 26th December, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [687] 3 

the rates of pension specified in column (3) of the Scales shall have 
(i) 
effect on and from 05 January 2024 whether the period taken into account by 
the assessment began on, before, or after that date, and, 

the amounts of gratuity specified in column (2) of the Scales shall be 
(ii) 
payable only where the period taken into account by the assessment of the 
degree of disablement began on or after 05 January 2024.

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 447 of 2020)), 74 (amended by section 7 of the Social
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2023 provides for an 
increase in the maximum rate of Injury Benefit payable from 01 January 2024 
and for increases in the rates of benefits payable under the Occupational 
Injuries Benefits Scheme from 05 January 2024. Parts 2-3 of Schedule 2 
provide for increases to the maximum rate of Disablement Gratuity and the 
weekly rates of Disablement Pension where the degree of disablement ranges 
from 100 per cent to 20 per cent. 

These Regulations provide for increases in the rate of Disablement Gratuity 
and the weekly rates of Disablement Pension where the degree of disablement 
ranges from 1 per cent to 19 per cent. The rates provided for in Schedule 3 
apply in respect of a continuing disablement of between 1 and 19 per cent 
which arose prior to 1 January 2012. Schedule 3A applies where the 
disablement occurs after 1 January 2012 and in such a case, disablement 
gratuity and gratuity pension are payable only where the range of disablement 
is greater than 14 per cent. 

The Regulations also provide for an increase in the rate of Injury Benefit 
payable to persons under the age of sixteen. If, in such a case, there is what 
amounts to full-time employment, or substantially full-time employment, the 
rate will increase by €12.00 (from €220.00 to €232.00). This is the same rate as 
the maximum rate payable to an adult. In all other cases the rate will increase 
by €5.70 (from €105.20 to €110.90). 

The rate increases, provided for by these Regulations, come into effect on 01 
January 2024 in the case of Injury Benefit and on 05 January 2024 in the case 
of Disablement Gratuity and Disablement Pension to coincide with the 
increases in rates provided for by the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous 
Provisions) Act 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [687] 7
